page.title: 10BERYSTEDE HOTEL
page.content: The original hotel was built in the 1870's by the Standish family in 30 acres of land in the Tudor and Gothic style.The turrets may have been the influence of Henry Standish's french wife.Royalty were frequent visitors; the Prince of Wales comforting the family after the 1886 fire.The ghost of the maid who tried to rescue jewels given to her by guests haunts the hotel to this day.In recent years a new block and a conference room have been added.The leisure facilities available include a pool,putting green and Victorian garden set in 9 acres of land.The hotel employs 118 people but only 30% are local.Ascot week has always been a highlight of the year from the time when Royalty visited to the present day when it is the busiest time of the year.
